abstract.p: Dr Robert Matz letter responds to June 18 Week in Review article on health-care rationing; asserts question is not whether to ration health care, but rather who will determine ground rules for rationing

block.p: Health care rationing has been around for a long time (Week in Review, June 18). Not everyone can go to the ''best'' hospital or doctor.
Health care rationing has been around for a long time (Week in Review, June 18). Not everyone can go to the ''best'' hospital or doctor.

In the United States, the cost of medical care has risen to a prominent position in the equation for optimal delivery and is fast becoming a determining factor in decision-making. The question is not whether to ration medical care, but rather who will determine ground rules. Will profit-driven health maintenance organizations, doctors, drug companies or the government write the rules, or -- as tried in Oregon -- will it be a societal decision?
ROBERT MATZ, M.D. New York, June 19, 2000
The writer is medical director, quality assurance and improvement, Mount Sinai Medical Center.
